title: Rocco Forte Hotels rated more popular that all other European hotel groups in the world
text:
Rocco Forte Hotels rated more popular that all other European hotel groups in the world Rocco Forte Hotels rated more popular that all other European hotel groups in the world Details Category: Hotel   10:45 A new study by luxury consulting agency, Luxury Branding, on the world leading luxury hotels for 2015, has reported The World’s Most Popular Luxury Hotel Brands. The independent analysis of 2.25 million travellers’ was conducted using reviews on TripAdvisor. With consistently excellent scores for all of the ten European properties, Rocco Forte Hotels is ranked as the fifth most popular brand in the highly competitive list. 
The accolade places Rocco Forte Hotels ahead of all other European hotel groups as well as most of the industry’s most established and best-known names, a real accolade for the brand of ten individual hotels and resorts. Sir Rocco Forte commented on the news “"What is particularly pleasing about this around is that it comes as a result of direct comments from our guests and underlines the consistency of the service we deliver. This makes us ahead of all other European hotel brands, as well as most of the major international brands”. Rocco Forte Hotels was established by Sir Rocco Forte and sister, Olga Polizzi and continues to be led by the Forte family who have been in hospitality for four generations. All of the hotels are landmarks in the cities they are found in, both old and new, and occupy magnificent buildings in sought after locations. The hotels are united by their distinctive approach to service ensuring guests experience the best of the cities and surrounding areas. Rocco Forte Hotels comprises: Hotel de Russie, Rome; Hotel Savoy, Florence; Verdura Resort, Sicily; The Balmoral, Edinburgh; Brown’s Hotel, London; The Charles Hotel, Munich; Villa Kennedy, Frankfurt; Hotel de Rome, Berlin; Hotel Amigo, Brussels; Hotel Astoria, St Petersburg. Future opening: Jeddah. Related articles
